Discrepancies between CodeCov and local reports are bound to occur This

percentages. To use the new report run jacocoDebugReport or
jacocoReleaseReport and open the HTML file in app/build/reports/jacoco
to view the results. I am currently exploring a way have to report
appear in Android Studio.

Refactor QuadrantItem SQL code

title: Refactor QuadrantItem SQL code
message:
Refactor QuadrantItem SQL code

Refactored QuadrantItemReader and QuadrantItemWriter to inherit from
QuadrantItemSqlInterator. The reader and writer now share some methods
that are used by both. Previous implementation had the writer
instantiating a reader to check if it exists.

The main goal of the refactor was to reduce the amount of code to
prevent use of case dependent methods. Lower level code was implemented
to update an SQL row given an item, quadrant number, and/or goal number.
Furthermore, querying information in a column can be down via higher
level methods that call a lower level method. The lower level method
will return whatever type in the that position; however, casting is
necessary.

SQL code for GoalReader and GoalWriter needs to be refactored, but was
not touched in this refactoring period due to not being used.

Static analysis was used on all the SQL code.

Fix Issue #18

title: Fix Issue #18
message:
Fix Issue #18

Fixed Issue #18 (https://github.com/Austin-Ray/Hexis/issues/18). The
issue did not result from the add item code as previously suspected, but
rather from the code that inflated the ViewHolder.

The issue was due to the ViewHolder being inflated to the same size as
the RecyclerView. The additional items were there; however, since each
ViewHolder was as large as the RecyclerView the other items did not
appear to exist. If you scrolled the RecyclerView you could find the
other items.

title: Fix remove item reappearance bug
message:
Fix remove item reappearance bug

Fixed the bug where deleted items would reappear if the app was
minimized then resumed. The bug appeared because the data storage wasn't
being informed of the deletion. Deletion was occuring in the view space
and changes were not being propagated to the model space.

Deletion was moved to higher in the view space where the presenter space
could update the model space. This resolved the bug.

Additionally, the EditItemDialogFragmentTest needed to be modified to
handle the changes. The resulting tests are more simplified than the
previous tests; however, there are areas that could be improved.

title: Fix Lint issues
message:
Fix Lint issues

Fixed lint issues causing a failed build on Travis CI. The cause was
from using vector graphics without proper configuration. Without this
configuration, the app may not build on platforms with an SDK < 23.

Other corrects were made based on suggestion from Lint. These include:

- Commenting out dimens values (they may be used again in the future)

- Removing hardcoded string

title: Add FloatingActionButton
message:
Add FloatingActionButton

activity_main to prevent the button's shadow from being cut off. Removal
of padding has the added benefit of improving the FragmentPager's
appearance.

title: Add basic Time Matrix layout
message:
Add basic Time Matrix layout

Added a basic time matrix layout that consists of four fragments with a
tab bar for the user to either click or swipe between. This is a
rudimentary layout to show how the time matrix should be presented. In
order to accomplish this, the Android Design Support Library was added
as a dependency.

title: Initial configuration
message:
Initial configuration

Configured repository with a cross-platform .gitignore, and integration
with Travis-CI and CodeCov. Both integrations should be successfully
setup with no more errors.

This is a squashed commit that resolves all previous issues experienced
with Travis-CI and CodeCov.
